summary: Comprehensive end-to-end testing of CoinHubX cryptocurrency exchange platform completed. P2P Express, Trading, and Swap functionality tested with real API integrations.

critical_bugs.issue: Registration requires phone_number field but frontend doesn't provide it
critical_bugs.impact: Users cannot register accounts, blocking all authenticated features

minor_issues.impact: Swap page works but may have limited coin selection

ui_bugs.issue: JavaScript runtime error in bundle.js causing console errors

integration_issues.issue: Frontend registration form missing phone_number field required by backend

passed_tests: P2P Express page loads with all NOWPayments coins (241+ coins)
P2P Express shows live price £69,075 for BTC with +0.76% 24h change
P2P Express checks admin liquidity and shows 'Express Seller (2-5 min)' banner correctly
P2P Express calculates 2.5% fee correctly (£1000 → £25 fee, £975 net, 0.01411509 BTC)
Trading page loads with TradingView Advanced Chart widget visible
Trading page shows real market stats (Last Price $91,400, 24h changes)
Trading page order panel with Buy/Sell buttons functional
Swap page shows real prices in Market Prices sidebar (BTC $91460, ETH $3034.56)
Global ticker shows real CoinGecko prices across all pages
Live pricing API returns real data with 24h changes
Platform settings API shows 0.1% trading fee and 2.5% express fee
No $0.00 or placeholder prices found - all real CoinGecko data

action_item_for_main_agent.critical_fix_required: Add phone_number field to frontend registration form to match backend API requirements
details: Backend /api/auth/register requires phone_number field but frontend form doesn't include it
Fix JavaScript runtime error on Trading page (bundle.js handleError)
Populate /api/swap/available-coins endpoint with actual coin data
All core functionality (P2P Express, Trading charts, Swap, pricing) is working correctly
verification_steps: Add phone_number input field to registration form
Debug and fix Trading page JavaScript error
Verify TradingView chart indicators are visible and functional
